author: Zach Harper
title: Mark Cuban on running for president: 'I get asked every day'
text:
As the United States prepares to go with various political changes with John Boehner resigning from being Speaker of the House and electing a new president in 2016, Dallas Mavericks owner Mark Cuban is playing around with the idea of throwing his hat into the ring. He tweeted on Friday questioning whether or not he could convince 200-plus politicians to write him in for the empty Speaker of the House seat.
He said the Constitution says he can try to make it happen.
Maybe I'll run for Speaker of the House. Can I convince 200+ politicians to write me in? Constitution says I can try. If not me how about?
â€” Mark Cuban (@mcuban) October 9, 2015 While he was probably only joking about throwing himself deep into the political world, he did say that he gets asked about running for president every day. He said it was a fun idea and that if he ran as a Democrat, he could defeat Hillary Clinton. He also said if he ran as a Republican, he could crush Donald Trump. He added that rich people believe they know more than everybody else, which leads to a little more arrogance in general.
From the Dallas Morning News :
Cuban gets asked all the time to run for President of the United States.
"I get asked every day," Cuban told CNBC.com recently. "It's a fun idea to toss around. If I ran as a Dem, I know I could beat Hillary Clinton. And if it was me vs. Trump, I would crush him. No doubt about it."
Cuban was asked about Trump, especially his "three-comma" net worth (billionaire), which gives Trump a certain swagger.
"Rich people just have a little more arrogance to think we know more than everyone else," Cuban said.
We certainly know Cuban is opinionated about many things. If he ended up being President Cuban, it would be a lot easier for him to get the Mavericks invited to the White House than just waiting to win a championship like they accomplished during 2011. I don't think we'd have to see him sell the Mavs to do the job either.
Senator Herb Kohl was in office from 1989 to 2013 and owned the Milwaukee Bucks from 1985 to 2014 when he sold the franchise for $550 million. That's not a bad return on investment considering he purchased them for $18 million in 1985. Maybe the Mavs being owned by the president could increase the value of that franchise even more? Mark Cuban running for president is an interesting idea. (USATSI) Topics: Dallas Mavericks , NBA
